name: The Atlas of Economic Complexity
description: Harvard Growth Labâ€™s research and data visualization tool used to understand the economic dynamics and new growth opportunities for every country worldwide.

SDGs.evidenceText: For every country worldwide, it helps policy makers push growth to the bottom of the pyramid  by helping them understanding new growth opportunities using trade data.
The Atlas places the industrial capabilities and knowhow of a country at the heart of its growth prospects using trade data.
As part of their efforts, they also developed, country complexity ratings to help guide national industrial policy that shapes a country's cities.
Helps policymakers understand growth projections for the next decade and how inequality between countries will unfold.
The complexity ratings also reduce waste in commonly untargetable and unexplainable industrial policy that is wasteful of a country's resources.

By supporting data-driven decision making, the institutional framework for industrial policy become less wasteful, and more objective, reducing the chance for corruption, and crony capitalism / regulatory capture.

With itself being a global partnership, between seven multi-stakeholders entities ranging from US Federal government, to private banks and even international organizations, it creates a solid foundation for global cooperation on leveraging trade data to support global policy.

organizations.name: Harvard Center for International Developement
